node.title: Eminem takes a knee during Super Bowl halftime show
node.description: While performing his classic hit "Lose Yourself" on Sunday night, the 15-time Grammy winner got on his knee and held his head.
node.content: ["Eminem took a knee during the star-studded Super Bowl halftime show\u00a0on Sunday night, becoming one of the most talked about moments of the year's biggest sporting event.", "While performing his classic hit \"Lose Yourself\" on Sunday night, the 15-time Grammy winner got on his knee and held his head. It appeared to be a gesture to\u00a0free agent quarterback and activist Colin Kaepernick, who led kneeling protests in 2016 during the national anthem to bring attention to police brutality and racial injustice. Kaepernick has\u00a0maintained he's been\u00a0kept off of the field because of the protests.\u00a0", "Since Kaepernick has not been signed by any teams since the 49ers opted not to re-sign him, other players have also taken a knee during the national anthem. In 2017, former President Trump spoke out against the players, saying they were \"ruining the game.\"\u00a0", "But after the murder of George Floyd by a police officer and racial justice protests throughout the country, NBA players and coaches from four teams took a knee during the national anthem in the first set of games in the 2020-21 season.\u00a0", "An NFL spokesperson told the New York Times the league was \"aware\" the rapper was planning to kneel during Sunday's game, disputing a report that the league had told him not to. The spokesperson told the Times players, coaches and personnel were free to take a knee before Sunday's game and no one has been penalized for kneeling since 2016.\u00a0", "CBS News reached out to the NFL for comment, but the NFL did not immediately respond.", "The halftime show was a star-filled show, with 90s legends like Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Dr. Dre and Mary J Blige taking the stage. According to the Los Angeles Times, the show was a\u00a0product\u00a0of the NFL's high profile deal with mogul and rapper Jay-Z.\u00a0", "Following the show, the Los Angeles Rams\u00a0defeated\u00a0the Cincinnati Bengals 23-20 after a late-game touchdown.\u00a0", "Christopher Brito is a social media producer and trending writer for CBS News, focusing on sports and stories that involve issues of race and culture."]
